intro: Lathyrus diversifolius, commonly known as the variable leaf pea, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes and clusters of pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
